application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Washington, DC, USA
description:
The Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team protects, sustains, and enables Google's ability to thrive by ensuring Google’s people and spaces are safe while preserving our open, collaborative culture. In this role as part of a global marketing and communications team, you’ll help GSRS achieve its mission by developing and delivering effective internal marketing and communications and being a thought partner to leaders. You’ll partner closely with colleagues from PR, internal communications, Legal, and People Operations to develop the strategy and playbooks to respond effectively to disruptive incidents. A crisis communications expert, you’ll advise leaders and execute communications during incidents with calm, speed, and good judgment in a matrixed environment.

Building and protecting the GSRS brand with Google leaders and Googlers is another key responsibility. You’ll proactively develop and execute creative marketing and communication strategies that will help the GSRS team, Google, and Googlers adapt to change and prepare for and respond to disruptive events.You’ll craft narratives that stick and make the complex easy to understand for a variety of audiences and channels. In addition, you’ll track the effectiveness of your plans, using what you've learned to make the process more effective and efficient for future projects.

The Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS) team creates inspiring spaces and innovative services that bring Google’s culture and values to life. We build and maintain all aspects of what keeps our Googley workspaces operating seamlessly across multiple cities and regions globally. We also manage the industry-leading services that help make Google a great place to work -- from how we design healthy and collaborative workspaces, create energizing food experiences, provide convenient transportation and fitness options, to delivering inclusive environments where Google and our employees can thrive.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in internal communications, executive communications, marketing, or a related field (e.g., PR, journalism, government, political, or nonprofit settings).
  • Experience managing crisis communications.
  • Experience leading distributed team members or outsourced communications or marketing service organizations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience developing and deploying marketing strategies across a global organization and with change management (i.e. developing communications strategies and plans around changes that affect people, process, and/or technology).
  • Experience collaborating with and influencing leaders and cross-functional partners through relationships, expertise, and data.
  • Ability to work calmly and collaboratively in fast-paced environments, maintaining good judgment and the ability to escalate appropriately.
  • Creative problem-solver, with the ability to think, plan, and execute on multiple projects autonomously and in an organized fashion.
  • Effective communication skills, with the ability to write in the Google voice and with tact and diplomacy.
responsibilities:
• Lead the development and implementation of our incident communications strategy. Manage issues with speed and good judgment, track effectiveness of campaigns, and manage feedback channels.
  • Lead the internal communications and marketing strategy, and associated implementation, for multiple initiatives from beginning to end.
  • Create high quality, compelling communications and marketing materials, at the organizational and Google-wide levels, for a variety of channels.
  • Be a trusted advisor and strategic thought partner to leaders, internal clients, and vendor partners. Set the direction for internal communications and marketing efforts, build consensus across stakeholders from cross-functional teams, and influence decision-making to achieve business objectives.
  • Manage multiple complex operational and strategic projects and initiatives, from conception to post mortem, leading cross-functional, global teams to get work done.
title: Marketing and Communications Manager, Global Security and Resilience Services
